intro: Glossoloma pycnosuzygium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as those in the families Fabaceae and Myrtaceae. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its berries are usually red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to its parasitic nature, it can cause significant stress to its host plants if left unchecked.
